statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Jong Hyok loves strings. One day he gives a problem to his friend you. He writes down n strings Pi in front of you, and asks m questions. For i-th question, there is a string Qi. We called strange set(s) = {(i, j) | s occurs in Pi and j is the position of its last character in the current occurence}. And for ith question, you must answer the number of different strings t which satisfies strange set(Qi) = strange set(t) and t is a substring of at least one of the given n strings.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
First line contains T, a number of test cases.

For each test cases, there two numbers n, m and then there are n strings Pi and m strings Qj.(i = 1��n, j = 1��m)


1 <= T <= 10
1 <= n <= 100000
1 <= m<= 500000
1 <=|Pi|<=100000
1 <=|Qi|<=100000
$\sum_{i=1}^{n} |P_i|\leq 100000$
File size is less than 3.5 megabytes.

statement.title: Output
statement.content:
For each test case, first line contains a line ��Case #x:��, x is the number of the case.

For each question, you should print one integer in one line.

statement.title: Sample Input
statement.content:
1
2 2
aba
ab
a
ab

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case #1:
1
2


Hint

strange set(��a��) ={(1, 1), (1, 3), (2, 1)}.
strange set(��ab��) ={(1, 2), (2, 2)}.
strange set(��b��) ={(1, 2), (2, 2)}.
